column4: Hi, I recenetly installed ubuntu 9.04 and selected it to be installed on a second partition. I then decided that I didn't want it on its own partition and rather installed inside my current os(win7). Now i get a grub 22 error on boot, and can't access win7. I tried to run the dvd for win7 using the recovery tools but it tells me that i don't have an OS isntalled. Can anyone assist me with this please? Thanks in advance.
never install 2 OS on the same partition, they fight it out and one will lose
Ubuntu has an option to be installed within windows and its given a boot option on startup.
its still not wise to install 2 OS on the SAME partition
your most likely going to have to repair or reinstall both OS, on separate partitions
Win7 is still active and i can access it if i boot hirens bootcd
ya i dont know about win 7, what does it do when you try to boot win 7? and what os are you inside right now?
I'm on live cd at the moment.
does 7 boot at all?
if anyboy can help you solve this problem its the super nerds in this channel
card or USB adapter?
do you think you would be able to assist me in getting the change to stay
i have no experience in such matters, i just installed Ub 2 days ago, sorry, id love to help you but im not sure id be of any use
